stork.feather

Class Relative<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • stork.feather.Relative<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - The type of the object wrapped by this Relative class.

    public class Relative<T>
extends Object
    An object wrapper with contextual information regarding the object's origin in some hierarchical transaction. This could be used in, for example, an ongoing transfer or crawling operation. This wraps information such as the Resource of origin (e.g., the Resource an object came from), the root Resource in the context the originating Resource is relative to (e.g., the root of the transfer), and the selection path of the origin relative to the root. This relationship can be more simply thought of as: root.select(path).equals(origin)

    • Constructor Detail

      • Relative

        public Relative(T object,
        Resource root,
        Path path)
        Wrap object with the given root and path. The origin will be selected automatically based on root and path.
        Parameters:
        object - the T to wrap.
        root - the operational root.
        path - the Path from root to origin.

      • Relative

        public Relative(T object,
        Resource root,
        Path path,
        Resource origin)
        Wrap object with the given root, path, and origin. This is intended to circumvent the slight overhead of selecting origin from root and path if origin is already known. However, this means it is possible to create a Relative wrapper such that !root.select(path).equals(origin), violating the class contract. Since this class is primarily used inside this package, it shouldn't be a problem. If you're using it outside the package, just play nice.
        Parameters:
        object - the T to wrap.
        root - the operational root.
        path - the Path from root to origin.
        origin - the operation origin of object.

    • Method Detail

      • isRoot

        public boolean isRoot()
        Check if this object originated from the root.
        Returns:
        true if path is a root path; false otherwise.

      • wrap

        public <S> Relative<S> wrap(S object)
        Wrap another object using the same relativity information as this wrapper.
        Parameters:
        object - the new object to wrap.
        Returns:
        A new Relative wrapper based on this one but wrapping a different object.
